page.title: 12ASLOCKTON TRAIN STATION
page.content: The Aslockton train station runs 24 hours a day 7 days a week. It is always manned because there is also a level crossing. Each shift lasts 8 to 12 hours. There are an average of 34 trains through a day.There are more passengers trains than goods trains.The busiest days are Thursdays and Fridays. There are two tracks one leads to Grantham, which is a main inter-city station, and the other leads to Nottingham.There are three stops before Nottingham Bingham, Netherfield, and Radcliffe. The lines future is quite secure, because the passenger trains are very convenient. There is a very limited bus service into Nottingham, and an even poorer one to Bingham; So most people who work in the city use the train as it is cheap and quick.
